faq.question: What versions of Java does CeltiXfire support?
Does CeltiXfire support development languages other than Java?
faq.answer: Yes. CeltiXfire supports the development of services using Javascript and E4X.

faq.question: Does CeltiXfire provide any tools to assist in developing applications with CeltiXfire?

answer.p: CeltiXfire includes a number of command-line based tools for generating the artifacts needed to develop applications with CeltiXfire. These include:

ul.li: wsdl2java for generating Java code from a service contract.
java2wsdl for generating a service contract from a Java class.
xsd2wsdl for generating a service contract from an XMLSchema document.

answer.p: In addition there are a number of command lines tools for manipulating service contracts.

faq.question: Are there any GUI tools for working with CeltiXfire?
faq.answer: No. CeltiXfire is working with the STP project at the Eclipse project to develop GUI based tools for working with SOAs.

faq.question: Does CeltiXfire provide any orchestration features?
faq.answer: No. However, CeltiXfire services can be orchestrated using a number of BPEL engines. There is a demo illustrating CeltiXfire working with Intalio's BPEL offering on the demo page at demos page.
